item.title: "Could Have Got Him Out 6-7 Times In 2 Overs": Jasprit Bumrah's Blunt Take On Sam Konstas With Whom .. - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah Reflects on Challenging Clash with Sam Konstas During Fourth Test

Date: December 26, 2024 Source: NDTV Sports

In a recent Test match against Australia, Jasprit Bumrah discussed his experience facing debutant Sam Konstas, expressing confidence in his abilities despite Konstas's impressive performance.

  • Bumrah felt he could have dismissed Konstas several times in the early overs.
  • Konstas played aggressively, scoring 60 runs with two sixes off Bumrah.
  • This marked the first time in three years Bumrah was scored against with a six in Test cricket.
  • Bumrah reflected on the unpredictable nature of cricket, emphasizing that performance can vary from day to day.
  • He praised the challenges of playing in Australia, highlighting the testing conditions for bowlers.
  • Bumrah acknowledged the talent of Australian batsman Steve Smith, describing him as a challenging opponent.
Bumrah stated, "Initially I felt I could have got him out 6-7 times in the first two overs but that's how cricket goes. Some days it pays off, some days it doesn't."

Overall, Bumrah's insights shed light on the dynamics of international cricket, particularly in high-pressure situations against young talents like Konstas.

item.title: India vs Australia 4th Test, Day 3 Live Updates: Nitish Reddy On Cusp Of Historic Record As Match Resumes After Rain - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia 4th Test, Day 3 Live Score Updates: Nitish Reddy On Cusp Of Historic Record As Match Resumes After Rain

Publication Date: December 28, 2024 Source: NDTV

Nitish Kumar Reddy is on the verge of his maiden Test century, playing aggressively for India. With a crucial partnership alongside Washington Sundar, India aims to surpass Australia’s score and avoid the follow-on.

  • Reddy is currently unbeaten at 85, needing just two runs for a record at No. 8 against Australia.
  • Washington Sundar is nearing a half-century as well.
  • India has avoided follow-on, now looking to surpass Australia’s first innings score.
  • After rain interruptions, the match is set to resume, which has excited fans.
“AND INDIA HAVE DONE IT!!!! The partnership between Nitish Reddy and Washington Sundar has helped the visitors escape the follow-on.”

As the match progresses, Reddy's performance could lead to significant achievements for the Indian team.

item.title: India vs Australia 4th Test, Day 3 Live Updates: Nitish Reddy, Washington Sundar Stitch Historic Partnership As India Go Past 300 - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia 4th Test, Day 3 Live Updates: No Resumption Time Out As Drizzle Continues In Melbourne

Publication Date: Today | Source: NDTV

The ongoing rain in Melbourne has delayed the resumption of play on Day 3 of the 4th Test match between India and Australia.

  • Ongoing drizzle has led to uncertainty regarding the resumption of the match.
  • No announcements have been made about a potential restart time.
  • Fans eagerly await updates as the weather conditions are being monitored closely.
“The match has been subjected to numerous weather-related delays today.”

As the weather remains unpredictable, spectators and players alike are hoping for a break in the rain to allow the game to continue.

item.title: ‘Utter rubbish…’: Pranab Mukherjee's daughter Sharmistha slams Congress amid Manmohan Singh memorial row - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Sharmistha Mukherjee Criticizes Congress Over Memorial Controversy for Manmohan Singh

Date: Dec 28, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

Sharmistha Mukherjee, daughter of former president Pranab Mukherjee, criticized the Congress party for not convening a Congress Working Committee (CWC) meeting after her father’s death in 2020, while supporting a request for a memorial for former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh.

  • Sharmistha stated the Congress didn’t hold a CWC meeting after Pranab Mukherjee's passing.
  • She referenced diary entries showing that a CWC meeting was held for K.R. Narayanan's passing.
  • Despite criticism, she supports a memorial for Manmohan Singh, who passed away at 92.
“When baba passed away, Congress didnt even bother 2 call CWC 4 condolence meeting. That’s utter rubbish...” - Sharmistha Mukherjee

In conclusion, Sharmistha Mukherjee’s remarks highlight ongoing tensions within the Congress party regarding how it honors its leaders, contrasted with her support for a memorial for Manmohan Singh.

item.title: Trump has already picked a side in H-1B debate between MAGA and Silicon Valley, he sides with… - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Trump Takes Sides in H-1B Visa Debate Amid MAGA and Silicon Valley Tensions

Date: Dec 28, 2024 08:56 AM IST | Source: Hindustan Times

The article discusses the internal conflict within Trump's support base regarding H-1B visas for skilled workers, highlighting his alignment with Silicon Valley supporters against the anti-immigration stance of MAGA proponents.

  • Trump favors a more open high-skilled immigration policy, siding with Silicon Valley.
  • Criticism arises after the appointment of Sriram Krishnan, who advocates for immigration reform.
  • Trump’s allies, Musk and Ramaswamy, defend the H-1B program against MAGA criticisms.
  • Concerns about the impact of H-1B visas on American jobs and racial undertones in the debate.
"OF COURSE my companies and I would prefer to hire Americans and we DO, as that is MUCH easier than going through the incredibly painful and slow work visa process. HOWEVER, there is a dire shortage of extremely talented and motivated engineers in America." - Elon Musk

The conflict underscores a significant rift within the Republican Party as immigration policy continues to create divisions between traditional supporters and tech industry interests.

item.title: Watch: Nitish Reddy's 'Pushpa' celebration on reaching maiden Test fifty - The Times of India
item.description:
Nitish Reddy Celebrates Maiden Test Fifty with 'Pushpa' Dance

Publication Date: Recent; Source: Times of India

Nitish Kumar Reddy has impressed in the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy series and achieved his first Test fifty during the fourth Test against Australia at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.

  • Reddy debuted in the Perth Test and had notable scores throughout the series.
  • He scored his maiden Test fifty, helping India surpass the follow-on mark.
  • Celebrated his fifty with the 'Thaggede le' dance from the movie 'Pushpa', entertaining fans and players alike.
“His celebration evoked laughter and admiration from legends in the game.”

This performance marks a significant milestone in Reddy's career, showcasing his potential on the international stage.

item.title: Azerbaijani and U.S. officials suggest plane that crashed may have been hit by weapons fire - The Hindu
item.description:
Azerbaijani and U.S. officials suggest plane that crashed may have been hit by weapons fire

Date: December 28, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

The article discusses the crash of an Azerbaijani airliner, suggesting that Russian air defense systems may have caused the incident.

  • The plane crashed on December 25, 2024, killing 38 people and injuring 29 others.
  • A U.S. official stated there were indications that the jet was downed by Russian air defenses.
  • Azerbaijan's Minister of Digital Development pointed out potential external impacts as per preliminary expert conclusions.
  • Survivors described loud noises and explosions before the crash, indicating possible weapon discharge.
  • Azerbaijan Airlines has blamed the crash on “physical and technical interference.”
  • Investigations are ongoing with teams examining the crash site in Grozny.
“If it’s proven that the plane crashed after being hit by Russian air defenses, it would be the second deadly civil aviation accident linked to fighting in Ukraine.”

The incident raises significant concerns over air safety in conflict regions and the impact of military actions on civilian aviation.

item.title: Donald Trump asks US Supreme Court to delay ban on TikTok - The Times of India
item.description:
Donald Trump Requests Supreme Court to Postpone TikTok Ban

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: [News Source]

In a significant legal move, former President Donald Trump has filed a petition with the US Supreme Court asking for a delay in the enforcement of a recent ban on TikTok.

  • Trump's petition is part of ongoing legal battles surrounding the popular video-sharing app.
  • The request emphasizes potential economic impacts and free speech concerns.
  • This case could set important precedents regarding social media regulation.
“The implications of this ban reach far beyond individuals, affecting the entire digital landscape.”

This request highlights the continuing debate regarding data privacy, national security, and the role of social media in modern communication.

item.title: FIDE World Rapid and Blitz Chess Championships 2024: Carlsen announces shock withdrawal; Arjun, Harika, Humpy among leaders after Day 2 - ESPN India
item.description:
Carlsen Withdraws from 2024 FIDE World Rapid & Blitz Championships Amid Dress Code Controversy

Published on: Dec 28, 2024, Source: ESPN

Magnus Carlsen has withdrawn from the World Rapid & Blitz Championships due to a dress code issue, leading to a reshuffle in the leaderboard where Arjun Erigaisi, Harika Dronavalli, and Koneru Humpy emerge as leaders.

Key Points

  • Carlsen faced a $200 fine and refused to change attire, resulting in his withdrawal.
  • Volodar Murzin leads the Open championship, followed closely by Arjun Erigaisi and others.
  • Harika Dronavalli and Koneru Humpy topped the Women's division after eight rounds.
  • Carlsen expressed frustration with FIDE, stating a desire to distance himself from the organization.
"I am pretty tired of FIDE, so I want no more of this. I don't want anything to do with them." - Magnus Carlsen

FIDE responded by emphasizing the need for adherence to established dress code regulations for professionalism.

Conclusion

The incident has sparked discussions around player treatment and organizational policies in professional chess.

item.title: US News Live Today December 28, 2024: Man arrested in New York City subway fire case indicted for first-degree murder - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Man Indicted for First-Degree Murder in New York Subway Fire Case

Date: December 28, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

A grand jury has indicted Sebastian Zapeta for murder and arson in connection with a fire in a New York subway that resulted in severe injuries to a sleeping woman.

  • Sebastian Zapeta was charged after allegedly setting a woman on fire while she was sleeping on the subway.
"This incident highlights the urgent need for safety measures in our public transportation system." - Local official

The indictment is a critical step in addressing public safety concerns in urban transport systems.

item.title: 'Security rushed to the affected areas': Manipur CM Biren Singh condemns 'indiscriminate firing by Kuki m - The Times of India
item.description:
Manipur CM Biren Singh Condemns Indiscriminate Firing by Kuki Militants

Date: October 2023
Source: The Economic Times

The Chief Minister of Manipur, Biren Singh, has condemned the recent attacks carried out by Kuki militants, calling for immediate security measures in the affected areas.

  • The CM criticized the indiscriminate firing that has put lives at risk.
  • He has urged law enforcement to enhance their operations to ensure the safety of the citizens.
  • The situation has raised concerns about ongoing tensions in the region.
"Security is being rushed to the affected areas to restore peace and order," said Singh.

In conclusion, the CM's statements reflect a strong stance against violence in Manipur, emphasizing the government's commitment to protecting its citizens.

item.title: Allu Arjun appears before court virtually in Sandhya Theatre stampede case, cites security reasons - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Allu Arjun Appears Virtually in Sandhya Theatre Stampede Case

Date: Dec 28, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Actor Allu Arjun appeared virtually before a local court regarding his bail in the Sandhya Theatre stampede case, where a woman died due to a stampede at his film's premiere.

  • Allu Arjun is accused in a case related to a stampede during the premiere of his film Pushpa 2: The Rule.
  • The incident occurred on December 4, resulting in the death of a 35-year-old woman and injuries to her son.
  • The hearing for his bail plea has been postponed to December 30.
  • Allu Arjun had been arrested earlier and was granted interim bail.
“Allu Arjun appeared citing security reasons and to avoid public inconvenience.”

The case continues to attract public and media attention as it raises questions about crowd management during film premieres.

item.title: India vs Australia 4th Test, Day 3 Live Updates: Nitish Reddy Nears 50, 250 Up For India But Follow-On Scare Remains - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia 4th Test, Day 3 Live Score Updates

Date: December 28, 2024 | Source: NDTV Sports

India is currently facing a tough challenge against Australia in the 4th Test with Nitish Reddy and Washington Sundar attempting to steer the match amidst the pressure of a potential follow-on.

  • Nitish Reddy is nearing his half-century, playing aggressively alongside Washington Sundar.
  • As of the latest updates, India has scored 250 runs, but the threat of a follow-on looms large.
  • This match is critical for India’s chances in the World Test Championship.
“If India lose this match, the path to the World Test Championship will be all but over.”

The outcome of this match is crucial in determining India's future in the series and their overall standing in the World Test Championship.

item.title: ‘Baby John’ box office collection Day 3: Varun Dhawan starrer misses Rs 20 crore mark as collections fall - TOI Etimes
item.description:
‘Baby John’ Box Office Collection Day 3: Varun Dhawan's Film Struggles to Reach Rs 20 Crore

Publication Date: N/A Source: Times of India

After a lukewarm start, Varun Dhawan’s film Baby John has continued to drop in box office performance, recording just Rs 3.65 crore on its first Friday, which has raised concerns regarding its future collections.

  • The film started with Rs 11.25 crore but fell sharply by 57.8% to Rs 4.75 crore on the second day.
  • Its total collection now stands at Rs 19.65 crore, just missing the Rs 20 crore mark.
  • It was produced on a budget of Rs 160 crore with projections suggesting a lifetime collection of only Rs 50 crore.
  • The movie faces stiff competition from other releases like Pushpa 2 and Mufasa: The Lion King.
  • Directed by Kalees, it is a Hindi remake of the Tamil film Theri.
“Industry watchers will be closely monitoring the weekend collections to determine if Baby John can recover from its slow start.”

Overall, the film’s disappointing performance in its opening days may challenge its ability to break even, making the upcoming weekend critical for improving its box office standing.

item.title: Barclays fires 15 Wall Street bankers before Christmas holidays, axes bonuses in brutal layoff move: Repo - The Times of India
item.description:
Barclays Fires 15 Wall Street Bankers Ahead of Christmas, Cancels Bonuses

Publication Date: December 2023

Source: Financial News

In a significant move before the holiday season, Barclays has laid off 15 bankers from its Wall Street operations and made the decision to cancel their bonuses.

  • Barclays is streamlining its workforce in light of changing market conditions.
  • The affected employees were informed of their termination in a blunt announcement.
  • This action reflects broader trends in the financial industry as firms adapt to economic pressures.
“This is a tough decision, but necessary for the future of the company,” said a Barclays spokesperson.

The layoffs at Barclays signify the challenges facing the financial sector, especially as companies reevaluate their staffing needs amidst market volatility.

item.title: Just one session of exercise can keep your brain supercharged till the next day - The Times of India
item.description:
Just One Session of Exercise Can Supercharge Your Brain Until the Next Day

Publication Date: [Insert Date] | Source: [Insert Source]

A recent study by University College London reveals that only one session of exercise can enhance memory benefits for over 24 hours. This emphasizes the importance of physical activity not just for physical health, but also for cognitive enhancement.

  • The study involved 76 participants aged 50 to 83 engaging in moderate to vigorous physical activity.
  • Memory tests showed improved performance the day after exercising.
  • Participants reported less sitting time and more deep sleep, contributing to memory improvement.
  • This research uses a unique “micro-longitudinal” study design, tracking daily activities of participants.
  • Findings were published in the International Journal of Behavioral Nutrition and Physical Activity.
“Our findings suggest that the short-term memory benefits of physical activity may last longer than previously thought, possibly to the next day instead of just the few hours after exercise,” Dr. Mikaela Bloomberg stated.

This research underscores the cognitive benefits derived from regular physical activity and highlights the need for mindful incorporation of exercise into daily routines.

item.title: 'Rohit Sharma is finished': India captain told to 'retire', hand over leadership to Bumrah as fans lose patience - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Rohit Sharma Faces Calls to Retire as Frustration Grows Among Fans

Date: Dec 28, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Rohit Sharma’s disappointing performance as an opener has sparked criticism and calls for him to retire. Following a poor showing in the fourth Test against Australia, fans are urging him to step down and hand over the captaincy to Jasprit Bumrah.

  • Rohit Sharma was dismissed for just 3 runs after facing five balls in the Melbourne Test.
  • His performance has been under scrutiny, with just 152 runs in his last 14 innings.
  • Netizens have expressed frustration on social media, calling for his retirement.
  • Ricky Ponting criticized Rohit's batting performance as lazy and unfocused.
  • Sunil Gavaskar suggested that Rohit might consider retirement if his form does not improve in upcoming matches.
“Out of form is one thing, but Rohit Sharma is giving Negative Energy now.” - Fan comment on social media

The ongoing debate around Rohit’s future in the team highlights the intense pressure on athletes to perform at the highest level.

item.title: ‘Stupid, stupid, stupid’: Rishabh Pant’s bizarre dismissal at MCG leaves Sunil Gavaskar fuming - The Indian Express
item.description:
Rishabh Pant's Dismissal at MCG Draws Criticism from Sunil Gavaskar

Publication Date: December 26, 2024 | Source: The Indian Express

In a disappointing turn during the Boxing Day Test match against Australia, Rishabh Pant's bizarre dismissal sparked outrage, particularly from former captain Sunil Gavaskar.

  • Pant began confidently, playing aggressive yet calculated shots until the 56th over.
  • Gavaskar criticized Pant's choice to attempt a risky 'falling sweep' shot while two fielders were positioned for it.
  • The dismissal was characterized by Gavaskar as “stupid” and regrettable, undermining the team's efforts.
  • Comments from other commentators echoed the sentiment that Pant's decision-making lacked prudence given the match context.
“Stupid, stupid, stupid!” - Sunil Gavaskar on Rishabh Pant's dismissal.

This incident showcases the fine line between aggression and recklessness in cricket, leaving fans and analysts questioning Pant's judgment.

item.title: Manmohan Singh funeral LIVE updates: Congress leaders pay last respects to former PM at AICC HQ in Delhi - The Hindu
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Manmohan Singh funeral LIVE updates: Former PM’s last rites at Nigambodh Ghat in Delhi - The Hindu
item.description:
Manmohan Singh funeral LIVE updates: Former PM’s last rites at Nigambodh Ghat in Delhi

Date: December 28, 2024 Source: The Hindu

Former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh will receive a State funeral with military honours at Nigambodh Ghat today. This event marks an important moment in Indian history.

  • The funeral is scheduled for 11:45 a.m. at Nigambodh Ghat.
  • His remains will be at the AICC headquarters for public homage from 8:30 a.m.
  • A memorial will be allocated by the government as per Congress's request.
  • Traffic restrictions are in place across major New Delhi routes due to the expected influx of attendees.
"Dr. Singh’s final journey will commence from headquarters to the cremation ground at 9:30 a.m.,” stated party general secretary K. C. Venugopal.

This state funeral is a testament to Dr. Singh's influence and legacy in Indian politics.

item.title: 'Live by the spam, die by the spam': Elon Musk claps back at MAGA censorship claims on X amid H-1B visa r - The Times of India
item.description:
'Live by the spam, die by the spam': Elon Musk responds to MAGA censorship claims amid H-1B visa controversy

Publication Date: October 2023, Source: Times of India

The article covers the growing tensions between Elon Musk and MAGA supporters over allegations of censorship on X, sparked by a disagreement on immigration and H-1B visas. Laura Loomer and other influencers claim they faced censorship after criticizing immigration policies.

  • Elon Musk is accused by MAGA supporters of silencing them on X after a clash regarding immigration and H-1B visas.
  • Laura Loomer claims her account was downgraded and her ability to purchase premium services was revoked after her remarks on immigration.
  • Musk responded to the accusations by tweeting about spam accounts and their consequences.
  • The controversy intensified due to Musk's defense of an Indian-American appointed as an AI policy adviser.
  • The debate involves various MAGA figures and highlights a rift within the supporters over immigration issues.
“I have now also been banned from being able to purchase premium. We are always told to buy premium. But if you criticize immigration, you get your premium check taken away and also get banned from buying Premium. Pure censorship. MAGA has been silenced.” - Laura Loomer

The ongoing feud illustrates deeper divisions within the MAGA community concerning immigration and highlights Musk's controversial stance on the issue.

item.title: 'Ego kha gya': Rishabh Pant slammed for 'gift-wrapping' his wicket to Australia - The Times of India
item.description:
'Ego kha gya': Rishabh Pant slammed for 'gift-wrapping' his wicket to Australia

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

Rishabh Pant faced heavy criticism after his reckless dismissal on Day 3 of the fourth Test against Australia, where he attempted an ill-judged shot leading to his wicket.

  • Pant was expected to help India through a challenging situation during the match.
  • After initially performing well, Pant's decision to play a premeditated shot resulted in him getting dismissed.
  • His dismissal sparked sharp reactions on social media, highlighting concerns about his mindset.
  • The five-match series is tied at 1-1, with both teams showcasing strong performances.
“What a crap shot by Rishabh Pant. Ego pe baat aa gayi thi and ego kha gya.”
“Rishabh Pant playing that pre-meditated ramp shot to a ball pitched outside offstump to get out.”

The match continues to build excitement as both teams vy for dominance in the ongoing series.

item.title: India vs Australia 4th Test, Day 3 Live Updates: Rishabh Pant Departs After Flashy Shot, India Stare At Follow On - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia 4th Test, Day 3 Live Updates

Date: December 28, 2024   |   Source: NDTV Sports

India is in a precarious position on Day 3 of the 4th Test against Australia after losing their seventh wicket, Ravindra Jadeja. With their follow-on score in jeopardy, the team is desperate to build a solid partnership to avoid defeat.

  • Australia posted a total of 474 runs in their first innings.
  • India is currently 221 runs for 7 wickets with Nitish Reddy and Washington Sundar at the crease.
  • Jadeja's departure marks a significant setback as he was expected to score critical runs.
  • If India fails to perform today, their chances of reaching the World Test Championship (WTC) final diminish significantly.
“The way India play today might well decide the course of the series and World Test Championship final equation.”

In conclusion, India's batting performance today is crucial to their WTC hopes, and every run counts as they face mounting pressure from the Australian bowlers.

item.title: A quick-commerce correction on the radar for consumer brands | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Quick Commerce Trends for Consumer Brands in 2025

Publication Date: 2024-12-01 Source: Company Business News

As quick commerce gained momentum in the direct-to-consumer market during 2024, brands are now reconsidering their reliance on instant delivery services for the upcoming year.

  • Brands such as Wellbeing Nutrition and Arata are shifting towards diverse distribution methods.
  • There's a growing focus on using own websites and physical stores to minimize dependency on quick commerce.
"Our strategy for 2025 involves a significant reduction in reliance on quick commerce platforms, ensuring sustainability and flexibility in our operations." - Industry Executive

The shift indicates a transitional phase for consumer brands adapting to market changes and exploring new sales channels.

This article delves into how India's developmental goals were at the forefront of Manmohan Singh's foreign policy during his tenure, highlighting the synergy between domestic priorities and international relations.

“Development and foreign policy are two sides of the same coin.”

The intersection of development and foreign policy is crucial for India's strategic positioning on the global stage.

item.title: Capricorn Daily Horoscope Today, December 28, 2024 predicts a productive love affair - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Capricorn Daily Horoscope Today, December 28, 2024 to know your astrological predictions

item.title: Arsenal player ratings vs Ipswich: Two in two for Kai Havertz! Germany star's tap-in proves decisive as Gunners edge out Tractor Boys to cut gap to leaders Liverpool to six points - Goal.com
item.description:
Arsenal player ratings vs Ipswich: Two in two for Kai Havertz!

Publication Date: Recent
Source: GOAL

Arsenal secured a narrow 1-0 victory over Ipswich, closing the gap to Premier League leaders Liverpool to six points. Kai Havertz's goal proved decisive in a match dominated by Arsenal's performance.

  • Arsenal controlled the match, especially in the first half.
  • Kai Havertz scored the only goal in the 23rd minute.
  • The ruling of a second goal by Gabriel Jesus as offside kept the score at 1-0.
  • The second half saw more aggressive play from Ipswich.
  • Arsenal's defense held firm to secure the win.
“Arsenal thought they had a second in the 34th minute after Gabriel Jesus scored from an impossible angle, but the goal was ruled out for offside.”

The Gunners displayed strong performance and resilience, deserving their three points as they aim to catch up to Liverpool at the top of the table.

item.title: Congress demands memorial for Manmohan Singh; committed to building one: Government - The Times of India
item.description:
Congress Demands Memorial for Manmohan Singh; Government Commits to Building One

Publication Date: N/A | Source: N/A

The Indian Congress party has formally requested the government to construct a memorial for former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh. The government has expressed its commitment to delivering this request.

  • Manmohan Singh served as Prime Minister from 2004 to 2014.
  • The memorial is seen as a tribute to his contributions to India's development.
  • The request has gained support from various political factions.
“Manmohan Singh’s leadership during critical times has shaped modern India.”

This initiative signifies respect for Manmohan Singh’s legacy and aims to preserve his contributions for future generations.

item.title: 'Aap Hi Boliye': Sanjay Manjrekar & Irfan Pathan Clash Over Yashasvi Jaiswal-Virat Kohli Run-Out | Watch - News18
item.description:
'Aap Hi Boliye': Sanjay Manjrekar & Irfan Pathan Clash Over Yashasvi Jaiswal-Virat Kohli Run-Out

Date: December 27, 2024, Source: News18

Former cricketers Sanjay Manjrekar and Irfan Pathan engaged in a heated argument regarding Yashasvi Jaiswal's run-out during the Boxing Day Test. Manjrekar blamed Virat Kohli for the mistake, while Pathan defended him.

  • Manjrekar felt Kohli made a 'schoolboy error' by not watching his partner.
  • Pathan disagreed, stating that the striker can also deny a run.
  • The argument escalated with both cricketers sharing their perspectives on cricket's running rules.
“Just because it’s Virat Kohli, we are thinking too much from his point of view. It was a very school [boy] error...” - Sanjay Manjrekar

This clash highlights differing interpretations of cricket's running rules and the dynamics of sports commentary.
